channel.title: The Real Views podcast
channel.description: Cross cultural magazine and newspaper featuring the critical issues facing ethnic groups, women, seniors, people with disabilities and minorities as well as those who care, support or work with them. Included is music, festivals and fun times of Louisiana
channel.itunes:subtitle: Enjoy the sights and sounds of Louisiana.
channel.itunes:author: Carol Forsloff
channel.itunes:summary: Cross cultural magazine and newspaper featuring the critical issues facing ethnic groups, women, seniors, people with disabilities and minorities as well as those who care, support or work with them. Included is music, festivals and fun times of Louisiana

item.title: The Renaissance of the Spiritual: The Great Voice of Valerie Francis
item.description: Valerie Francis embodies the voice of the greatest singers of our country, those today and those who went before. For those of us who remember the beloved Mahalia Jackson, Valerie's voice brings the spiritual back to us with even greater intensity and cadence. Listen to her sing the upbeat and the sorrowful in this selection and others.
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
item.itunes:summary: Valerie Francis embodies the voice of the greatest singers of our country, those today and those who went before. For those of us who remember the beloved Mahalia Jackson, Valerie's voice brings the spiritual back to us with even greater intensity and cadence. Listen to her sing the upbeat and the sorrowful in this selection and others.

item.title: Johnny Earthquake and the Moondogs
item.description: Listen to Natchitoches' own, Johnny Earthquake and the Moondogs, do bunches of stuff with that down home sound with an upbeat mood.
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
item.itunes:summary: Listen to Natchitoches' own, Johnny Earthquake and the Moondogs, do bunches of stuff with that down home sound with an upbeat mood.

item.title: Trini Trigg brings the jazz sound to country
item.description: Trini Trigg, country western star with his downbeat music and his upbeat attitude was the star attraction at the Natchitoches Jazz Festival on April 5, bringing an enthusiastic crowd to its dancing feet.
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
item.itunes:summary: Trini Trigg, country western star with his downbeat music and his upbeat attitude was the star attraction at the Natchitoches Jazz Festival on April 5, bringing an enthusiastic crowd to its dancing feet.

item.title: Hardrick Rivers on the Cane River at the Natchitoches Jazz Festival
item.description: Listen to the great sounds of Hardrick Rivers, Natchitoches blues and jazz singer and trumpeteer as he presents some of his best sounds for the jazz festival.
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
item.itunes:summary: Listen to the great sounds of Hardrick Rivers, Natchitoches blues and jazz singer and trumpeteer as he presents some of his best sounds for the jazz festival.

item.title: The Real Gospel Sound
item.description: Listen to the down home gospel sounds straight from the church to your heart, that will bring you to your knees and tears to your eyes as you remember the good times, the bad times, the joy and the sorrows, and all that means when celebrating God in the best of gospel in the South.
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
item.itunes:summary: Listen to the down home gospel sounds straight from the church to your heart, that will bring you to your knees and tears to your eyes as you remember the good times, the bad times, the joy and the sorrows, and all that means when celebrating God in the best of gospel in the South.

item.title: Jazz, jazz, jazz in that great old fashioned way
item.description: Your whole body quivers to the music of Hardrick Rivers, the soulful singer of Central Louisiana, whose blast from the past with his horn and voice, will keep you rocking and humming for days. Come back again and again and listen and tell all your friends to listen too.
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
item.itunes:summary: Your whole body quivers to the music of Hardrick Rivers, the soulful singer of Central Louisiana, whose blast from the past with his horn and voice, will keep you rocking and humming for days. Come back again and again and listen and tell all your friends to listen too.

item.title: Steve Wells: The Musical Treasure of Natchitoches, Louisiana
item.description: Louisiana is known for its food and its funtimes. Nothing is more special than the music. It gets your feet dancing and your heart thumping. In Natchitoches, Louisiana, "the little New Orleans" of North Central Louisiana nothing beats Steve Wells. He plays that piano like nobody else, sings with style, and makes music with "instruments" that play right from his personal lungs. Listen to him make like Louis, as in Louis Armstrong, and just sit back and laissez le bon temps roulez--let the good times roll!
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
item.itunes:summary: Louisiana is known for its food and its funtimes. Nothing is more special than the music. It gets your feet dancing and your heart thumping. In Natchitoches, Louisiana, "the little New Orleans" of North Central Louisiana nothing beats Steve Wells. He plays that piano like nobody else, sings with style, and makes music with "instruments" that play right from his personal lungs. Listen to him make like Louis, as in Louis Armstrong, and just sit back and laissez le bon temps roulez--let the good times roll!

item.title: Way Down Yonder in New Orleans
item.description: Pretend that you are sitting on a street corner in New Orleans at the famous Cafe du Monde, sipping great coffee and eating beignets. Look over and see the horse and buggies as they get ready to take their passengers around Jackson Square. See the artists hang their paintings along the fence; the mimes entertain the crowds. And then right in front of your eyes, the magic of the music of New Orleans, on the famous street of jazz and joy.
item.dc:creator: Carol Forsloff
